forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. West wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the morning unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere is shrouded in a veil of clouds, accompanied by a steady anticipation of rain. The elusive sun struggles to penetrate the gray, likely casting a faint light over the city, yet the promise of moisture lingers in the air. With temperatures hovering around the cool end of the spectrum, it feels more like a gentle embrace of the ocean's chill than the warmth of spring. Breaths of wind whisper from the west, rustling the layered parking lots and busy streets, hinting at a familiar San Francisco nuance — that blend of briskness and dampness.

The forecast speaks of rain likely throughout the day, with the chance of precipitation creeping higher as the hours pass. Dressing in layers will be wise. A thicker shirt or light sweater beneath a waterproof jacket can hedge against both the chill and the anticipated drizzle, while sturdy footwear will keep you grounded on the slickened pavement. Today may not beckon outside adventures, yet it offers its own charm; a day spent in the embrace of a cozy café, the warmth of tea or coffee cradled in hand, while gazing out at the city blurred by raindrops on glass offers a rare intimacy — a moment to pause and reflect. Another option is to explore the labyrinth of shops and eateries that Downtown has to offer, immersing oneself in the city’s rhythm, all whilst letting the gentle patter of rain compose a serene soundtrack.
